Ryde High School is located on the
Isle of Wight
. Rob Hoddle is currently acting headteacher after suspension of previous headteacher Linda McGowan. It is one of five state-maintained high schools on the island, the others being
Carisbrooke High School , Cowes High School,
Medina High School and Sandown High School.

sec.p:
Ryde High covers a wide range of subjects.
English
Maths
Science (including double award, triple award and applied science)
ICT
P.E
Technology
Social Religious Studies (SRS)
History
Geography
Music
Languages (including French, Itallian, Spanish, Chinese etc)
Drama
Media Studies
Art
Business Studies
Photography (AS and A level only)
Philosophy and Ethics
Politics (AS and A level only)
Performing arts (AS and A level only)

The 'Concequence System' or 'C' system is made up of different punishments:
C1 = Verbal Warning
C2 = Final Verbal Warning
C3 = Report Card
C4 = On Call (Removed out of lesson via telephone)
C5 = Internal Exclusion
C6 = Governors Pannel (Report to governors)
All of these can be avoided if you are good during lessons (inc lunch and breaks's)
In results in good work and effort, you will get rewarded.

Types of rewards:
My Sticker(s) = These have codes printed on the front of the stickers to enter on the 'My Stickers' website to claim points and win prizes!
Postcard home = You might have to work quite hard in order to claim one of these
Certificate = You will have to work VERY hard to get one

Ryde High has been designated a language college for its excellent language facilities, Also For its Arts Facilitys. It was given an award for being a high performing specialty college and is currently the only school on the Isle of Wight to have it.
